posts.post_content: I honestly don't know why this guy is getting so much crap from everyone. posts.post_content: nocturnus was a over powered card and costs some where around $20 - $30 to get if you were not lucky enough to find one in a pack. At least with this guy he is allot cheaper price wise, unconditionally buffs vampires, and has an ability to steal creatures AND make them vampires?!?!? [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control) takes 5 mana to do that and if its destroyed you lose control of the creature, and it doesn't turn them into vampires. For black, creatures usually have to be dead in order to take control of them. I personally love to take my opponents cards while playing and smack them in the face with there own spell or card. Its allot more fun then going "Derp... OP aresomennersssss! I pewned Yerp Sorrys Buttt with mies net deck. Cuzz I so guud I can copys other peps decks..." Personally I wish they made a lord like this for the merfolk. I loved the **tap 5 untapped (*creature type*) you control do something awesome** ability back in onslaught. posts.post_content: I'm pretty sure everyone griping about the art here is taking it the wrong way... I don't think Wizards is pandering to the Twilight crowd, I think they're taking a shot at them. Yeah, he's a gay emo looking vampire, but so is Edward Cullen, and for some reason, millions of girls are captivated by him too. The art, the name, and the ability are satirical. And in all honesty, that's a pretty cool ability. Maybe not useful for the 5 turn death race of standard, but as a casual player, I love nifty things like this.

Posted By: BilliamQ (7/14/2010 7:40:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I run 4. If you have 5 vampires out (should be fairly easy) and your opponent has no removal for ONE TURN, it's usually game. If you have two or three captivators out, not only are you stealing their creature, you're pumping them up significantly. Also, you can use his ability the turn he comes out as long as you have 5 other vamps.  
  
I used to hate the art as well, but when I started beating people with this guy, he captivated even me.

posts.post_content:
I love this card... I honestly don't think I could care less about peoples opinions regarding art quality and tournament playability. For a casual vampire deck... and as an easy turn 3 drop, I'd be very happy with the outcome. I get to boost my existing and future vampires, and on the off chance I get 5 on the board, then the game just got a whole lot more interesting.
  
   
Just take it as it is; a fun, characterful card.

posts.post_content:
OK, first on the art.... It's actually good. Yes it looks creepy and not as glorious as the other vampires, but that's the point.... He's a vampire that steals your creatures or child.... He suppose to look disturbed.  
  
Now onto his second ability... You guys do realize it does not require him to tap to activate, right? And he can tap himself on the turn he's cast! And you can activate this as a response? In a weenie vampire deck, this is killer, even in Standard 2011, unless you're against RDW, you should have no problem pumping out 4 to 5 vampires by t4 before him, then you can start capturing on turn four. You should also include 4 [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) for increased consistence for creature recursion, and also 8 sac. lands like [Marsh Flats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Flats) and [Verdant Catacombs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Catacombs).  
  
t1: 1 drop  
t2: 2 1 drops  
t3: Pump more weenies for numbers, or Gatekeeper, or Nighthawk  
t4: Pump another 1 drop if you can for redundancy, then cast Captivating Vampire, t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: jfre81 (7/23/2011 9:14:26 PM)

posts.post_content:
Why is this card rated anything less than 4/5?   
Oh, yeah, because everyone decided that they hated it once they looked at the art and neglected to actually read the text.   
  
Why is this worse than Nocturnus?  
-Really bad art  
-Less of a buff  
-No flying buff  
-Less Power/Toughness  
  
Why is this better than Nocturnus?  
-It doesn't cost $15 a pop  
-Cheaper cmc  
-It doesn't NEED to be in a vamp deck  
-It doesn't NEED to be in a mono-black deck (not that you would run vamps in anything other than)  
-The +1 buff is ALWAYS on even in a mono-black (Swamps?)  
  
You will almost never get his second ability to fire, but that shouldn't actually detract from the card. Would I run four of these before Nocturnus? Of course not. Would that stop me from running four of this if I didn't have Nocturnus? Also, of course not.
